newsitem.title: USA: Aurum Software files to SEC for IPO in October.
newsitem.headline: Aurum Software files to SEC for IPO in October.

text.p: Aurum Software Inc said it had filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission a registration statement for a proposed initial public offering of 2.65 million shares of common stock.
The company said the price range of the stock would be between $9.00 and $11.00 per share.
The Alex Brown & Sons Inc would be the lead managers of the offering with plans to make it in late October or early November, it added.
The company said it would sell 2.5 million shares and shareholders would sell the remaining 150,000.
It said it would use the proceeds of the offering for working capital and other general corporate purposes, including the repayment of debt.
Aurum develops, markets and supports field sales automation, telemarketing, telesales and customer support functions of a business.
